author: Captain Michael Taylor
content: As I recollect tattoos were only for ratings as in the British Merchant Navy it was forbidden or certainly not encouraged for officers to be so marked.

author: Allan S
content: A career in the Navy and no tats. I also did not drink coffee on the mids, or middle watch. I was a freak I tell ya’

author: Phil
content:
I’m 67 and was in the USCG, not one tattoo on me, besides I think they are ugly.
Woman on TV show today was covered with them from her neck to her feet.

The idiots that got them now have to pay big $$ to have them removed!

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
“thirty-six percent of those ages 18 to 25, and 40 percent of those ages 26 to 40, have at least one tattoo, according to a fall 2006 survey by the Pew Research Center.”

Cement tomorrow’s prosperity by investing in tattoo removal today.
